channel.description: Recent content in Jenkins on Knowledge Hub

item.title: Jenkins
item.description: Jenkins pipeline code code-snippets How to get list of all installed plugins import jenkins.model.Jenkins Jenkins.instance.pluginManager.plugins.each{ plugin -> println ("${plugin.getDisplayName()} (${plugin.getShortName()}): ${plugin.getVersion()}") } How to test NodeJS node('linux') { stage('Linux :: NodeJS :: Default' ) { sh 'node --version' } stage('Linux :: NodeJS :: v8.9.0' ) { def nodejs = tool name: 'Linux NodeJS v8.9.0', type: 'jenkins.plugins.nodejs.tools.NodeJSInstallation' sh "$ {nodejs}/bin/node --version" } stage('Linux :: NodeJS :: v8.9.0:: withEnv' ) { withEnv(["PATH+NODE=${tool 'Linux NodeJS v8.

item.title: Jenkins Configuration
Jenkins-Docker
item.description: My use case is to run jenkins pipelines on docker build slaves. To achieve this we have to install Docker plugin. Docker plugin will integrate Jenkins with Docker. This docker plugin depends on Docker API plugin, so intall both the plugins. Restart is required for jenkins after installing these plugins. Manage Jenkins -> Manage Plugins -> Docker plugin , Docker slave plugin and Docker API plugin Once docker plugins are installed, restart jenkins master.
